instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2530: What is 820-2530? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.

threads.title: don't boot <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with green led when i plug the magsafe adapter but when i push the button on, nothing, same with the pad on the board.
I have the 3,35 on the pad. I look on the scope no trace of liquid.
What can i check? 
thanks

threads.title: don't boot <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
don't boot <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: No <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> on a 2530. Need the basics, PPBUS, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: don't boot <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi,
I make the measure:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> on F7000=12,58V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> on <TRANSISTOR>Q7930</TRANSISTOR>=3,338V
I check <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> on the board i find it, in diode mode 0,3, PP1V1R1V05_S5=1,060V
Thanks

threads.title: don't boot <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Do you have any idea? what can i check?

threads.title: don't boot <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at L6995, on 200K scale?
If lower than 30K, possible bad MCP.
MCP's RTC signals OK?
<CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR> doesn't fail on this board (as duke already said).
But its MCP is now so old...

threads.title: don't boot <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Ok i measure the L6995 = 5,212K
MCP RTC signal is 32.768
MCP clock 25MHZ is good too.
You think it's bad MCP?
thanks

threads.title: don't boot <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2530</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
5.2K sounds like bad MCP...
I saw another thread with similar value.
